lobby.fate: The fate of the Galaxy is in our hands
lobby.board_style_help:
Board style changes how the tiles are actually laid out on a newly generated map.
***
Changing this would cause you to expect different hex layouts, such as different patterns of tiles, usage of hyperlanes, or unorthodox placement of home worlds.
lobby.placement_style_help:
Placement style dictates where important tiles are placed. Most revolve around having at least one tile near the home system with good resources.
***
**Slice:** Places tiles like a normal player would. Prioritizes a good pathway to Mecatol, and filling in the area around the home system with good tiles.
***
**Initial:** Only guarantees a good tile right in front of the home system (on the way to mecatol). Everything else is random.
***
**Home:** Prioritizes all of the adjacent tiles to the home system and everything else is random.
***
**Random:** Shuffles the priority levels completely. No favoritism to tiles near the home system.
lobby.system_weighting_help:
Pick Style is used to determine how tiles are weighted for when they are placed on the board. A higher weighted tile means that the hex is more important, and so (depending on the placement style) it is put closer to home worlds to facilitate available assets.
***
**Balanced:** A custom weight which favors resources and planet count more than anomalies. This more accurately factors in tech specialties and influence as trade-offs to the 'Resource' pick.
***
**Resource:** Tiles are ordered primarily by their resource values. Higher resource planets are more coveted, and so are more important.
***
**Influence:** Similar to 'Resource', tiles are ordered primarily by their influence values.
***
**Random:** Tiles are completely randomly ordered. Expect chaotic and unbalanced maps.
lobby.ensure_anomalies_help:
Ensures that races get their beneficial anomalies
***
This option makes it so that Muaat will always receive a supernova, Saar will always receive an asteroid field, Empyrean will always receive a nebulae and Vuil'Raith will always receive a gravity rift.
lobby.randomize_priorities_help:
Randomizes the priority picks for each picking round.
***
Normally when placing tiles, this tool attempts to place the tiles so player 1 does not always get the best tiles. To do this, it follows the game setup rules and (in a 6 player game) player 1 gets to place tile 1 and 12, while player 6 gets to place tile 6 and 7.
***
Turning this on stops this from happening, and instead completely randomizes the placement order.
lobby.reverse_placement_help:
Reverses which tiles are placed first in placement order.
***
Tiles are normally placed in priority (see randomize priority help). This reverses the order, so that the last picks are first, which generally has the effect of pushing the more valuable tiles towards the center of the galaxy.

board.click_planet: Click on a planet on the map
board.click_tile: Click on a tile on the map
board.click_unit: Click on a unit on the map
board.use_card_or_pass: You can now use one of your action card or pass this step

LEADERSHIP.label: Leadership
LEADERSHIP.primary: Gain 3 command tokens. Spend any amount of influence to gain 1 command token for every 3 influence spent.
LEADERSHIP.secondary: Spend any amount of influence to gain 1 command token for every 3 influence spent.
LEADERSHIP.hit: A player might choose this card to gain more command tokens, enabling him to perform more actions during the action phase.

DIPLOMACY.label: Diplomacy
DIPLOMACY.primary: Choose 1 system, other than Mecatol Rex, that contains a planet you control; each other player places a command token from their reinforcements in the chosen system. Then, ready each exhausted planet you control in that system.
DIPLOMACY.secondary: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to ready up to 2 exhausted planets.
DIPLOMACY.hit: A player might choose this card if he feels threatened, to prevent other players from attacking his system.

POLITICS.label: Politics
POLITICS.primary: Choose a player other than the speaker. That player gains the speaker token. Draw 2 action cards. Look at the top 2 cards of the agenda deck. Place each card on the top or bottom of the deck in any order.
POLITICS.secondary: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to draw 2 action cards.
POLITICS.hit: A player might choose this card to draw action cards, increasing the variety of abilities that are available to him.

CONSTRUCTION.label: Construction
CONSTRUCTION.primary: Place 1 PDS or 1 space dock on a planet you control. Place 1 PDS on a planet you control.
CONSTRUCTION.secondary: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool in any system; you may place either 1 space dock or 1 PDS on a planet you control in that system.
CONSTRUCTION.hit: A player might choose this card to produce planetary structures, such as space docks and PDS units.

TRADE.label: Trade
TRADE.primary: Gain 3 trade goods. Replenish commodities. Choose any number of other players. Those players use the secondary ability of this strategy card without spending a command token.
TRADE.secondary: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to replenish commodities.
TRADE.hit: A player might choose this card to gain trade goods and commodities, which he could use to produce additional units or trade to other players.

WARFARE.label: Warfare
WARFARE.primary: Remove 1 of your command tokens from the game board; then, gain 1 command token. Redistribute any number of the command tokens on your command sheet.
WARFARE.secondary: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to use the PRODUCTION ability of 1 of your space docks in your home system.
WARFARE.hit: A player might choose this card to allow some of his ships to move twice, or to build a unit and move it during the same game round.

TECHNOLOGY.label: Technology
TECHNOLOGY.primary: Research 1 technology. Spend 6 resources to research 1 technology.
TECHNOLOGY.secondary: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool and 4 resources to research 1 technology.
TECHNOLOGY.hit: A player might choose this card to research a new technology that would grant him a new ability or unit upgrade.

IMPERIAL.label: Imperial
IMPERIAL.primary: Immediately score 1 public objective if you fulfill its requirements. Gain 1 victory point if you control Mecatol Rex; otherwise, draw 1 secret objective.
IMPERIAL.secondary: Spend 1 token from your strategy pool to draw 1 secret objective
IMPERIAL.hit: A player might choose this card to draw an additional secret objective, granting him additional routes to victory.

Amass Wealth.label: Amass Wealth
Amass Wealth.title: Spend 3 influence, 3 resources, and 3 trade goods.

Corner the Market.label: Corner the Market
Corner the Market.title: Control 4 planets that each have the same planet trait.

Diversify Rearch.label: Diversify Rearch
Diversify Rearch.title: Own 2 technologies in each of 2 colors.

Engineer a Marvel.label: Engineer a Marvel
Engineer a Marvel.title: Have your flagship or war sun on the game board.

Explore Deep Space.label: Explore Deep Space
Explore Deep Space.title: Have units in 3 systems that do not contain planets.

Found Research Outposts.label: Found Research Outposts
Found Research Outposts.title: Control 3 planets that have technology specialties.

Improve Infrastructure.label: Improve Infrastructure
Improve Infrastructure.title: Have structures on 3 planets outside of your home sytem.

Intimidate the Council.label: Intimidate the Council
Intimidate the Council.title: Have 1 or more ships in 2 systems that are adjacent to Mecatol Rex.

Lead from the Front.label: Lead from the Front
Lead from the Front.title: Spend a total of 3 tokens from your tactic and/or strategy pools.

Make History.label: Make History
Make History.title: Have units in 2 systems that contain legendary planets, Mecatol Rex, or anomalies.

Populate the Outer Rim.label: Populate the Outer Rim
Populate the Outer Rim.title: Have units in 3 systems on the edge of the game board other than your home system.

Push Boundaries.label: Push Boundaries
Push Boundaries.title: Control more planets than each of 2 of your neighbors.

Raise a Fleet.label: Raise a Fleet
Raise a Fleet.title: Have 5 or more non-fighter ships in 1 system.

Achieve Supremacy.label: Achieve Supremacy
Achieve Supremacy.title: Have your flagship or war sun in another player's home system or the Mecatol Rex system.

Become a Legend.label: Become a Legend
Become a Legend.title: Have units in 4 systems that contain legendary planets, Mecatol Rex, or anomalies.

Command an Armada.label: Command an Armada
Command an Armada.title: Have 8 or more non-fighter ships in 1 system.

Conquer the Weak.label: Conquer the Weak
Conquer the Weak.title: Control 1 planet that is in another player's home system.

Control the Borderlands.label: Control the Borderlands
Control the Borderlands.title: Have units in 5 systems on the edge of the game board other than your home system.

Form Galactic Brain Trust.label: Form Galactic Brain Trust
Form Galactic Brain Trust.title: Control 5 planets that have technology specialties.

Galvanize the People.label: Galvanize the People
Galvanize the People.title: Spend a total of 6 tokens from your tactic and/or strategy pools.

Hold Vast Reserves.label: Hold Vast Reserves
Hold Vast Reserves.title: Spend 6 influence, 6 resources, and 6 trade goods.

Master of Sciences.label: Master of Sciences
Master of Sciences.title: Own 2 technologies in each of 4 colors.

Patrol Vast Territories.label: Patrol Vast Territories
Patrol Vast Territories.title: Have units in 5 systems that do not contain planets.

Protect the Border.label: Protect the Border
Protect the Border.title: Have structures on 5 planets outside of your home system.

Rule Distant Lands.label: Rule Distant Lands
Rule Distant Lands.title: Control 2 planets that are each in or adjacent to a different, other player's home system.

Unify the Colonies.label: Unify the Colonies
Unify the Colonies.title: Control 6 planets that each have the same planet trait.

Become a Martyr.label: Become a Martyr
Become a Martyr.title: Lose control of a planet in a home system.

Become the Gatekeeper.label: Become the Gatekeeper
Become the Gatekeeper.title: Have 1 or more ships in both an alpha wormhole system and a beta wormhole system.

Betray a Friend.label: Betray a Friend
Betray a Friend.title: Win a combat against a player whose promissory note you had in your play area at the start of your tactical action.

Brave the Void.label: Brave the Void
Brave the Void.title: Win a combat in an anomaly.

Control the Region.label: Control the Region
Control the Region.title: Have 1 or more ships in 6 systems.

Cut Supply Lines.label: Cut Supply Lines
Cut Supply Lines.title: Have 1 or more ships in the same system as another player's space dock.

Darken the Skies.label: Darken the Skies
Darken the Skies.title: Win a combat in another player's home system.

Defy Space and Time.label: Defy Space and Time
Defy Space and Time.title: Have units in the wormhole nexus.

Demonstrate Your Power.label: Demonstrate Your Power
Demonstrate Your Power.title: Have 3 or more non-fighter ships in the active system at the end of a space combat.

Destroy Heretical Works.label: Destroy Heretical Works
Destroy Heretical Works.title: Purge 2 of your relic fragments of any type.

Destroy Their Greatest Ship.label: Destroy Their Greatest Ship
Destroy Their Greatest Ship.title: Destroy another player's war sun or flagship.

Dictate Policy.label: Dictate Policy
Dictate Policy.title: There are 3 or more laws in play.

Drive the Debate.label: Drive the Debate
Drive the Debate.title: You or a planet you control are elected by an agenda.

Establish a Perimeter.label: Establish a Perimeter
Establish a Perimeter.title: Have 4 PDS units on the game board.

Establish Hegemony.label: Establish Hegemony
Establish Hegemony.title: Control planets that have a combined influence value of at least 12.

Fight with Precision.label: Fight with Precision
Fight with Precision.title: Use Anti-Fighter Barrage to destroy the last of a player's fighters in a system.

Foster Cohesion.label: Foster Cohesion
Foster Cohesion.title: Be neighbors with all other players.

Fuel the War Machine.label: Fuel the War Machine
Fuel the War Machine.title: Have 3 space docks on the game board.

Gather a Mighty Fleet.label: Gather a Mighty Fleet
Gather a Mighty Fleet.title: Have 5 dreadnoughts on the game board.

Hoard Raw Materials.label: Hoard Raw Materials
Hoard Raw Materials.title: Control planets that have a combined resource value of at least 12.

Learn the Secrets of the Cosmos.label: Learn the Secrets of the Cosmos
Learn the Secrets of the Cosmos.title: Have 1 or more ships in 3 systems that are each adjacent to an anomaly.

Make an Example of Their World.label: Make an Example of Their World
Make an Example of Their World.title: Use Bombardment to destroy all of a player's ground forces on a planet.

Master of the Laws of Physics.label: Master of the Laws of Physics
Master of the Laws of Physics.title: Own 4 technologies of the same color.

Mechanize the Military.label: Mechanize the Military
Mechanize the Military.title: Have 1 mech on each of 4 planets.

Occupy the Fringe.label: Occupy the Fringe
Occupy the Fringe.title: Have 9 or more ground forces on a planet that does not contain 1 of your space docks.

Occupy the Seat of the Empire.label: Occupy the Seat of the Empire
Occupy the Seat of the Empire.title: Control Mecatol Rex and have 3 or more ships in its system.

Produce en Masse.label: Produce en Masse
Produce en Masse.title: Have units with a combinded Production value of at least 8 in a single system.

Prove Endurance.label: Prove Endurance
Prove Endurance.title: Be the last player to pass during a game round.

Spark a Rebellion.label: Spark a Rebellion
Spark a Rebellion.title: Win a combat against a player who has the most victory points.

Stake Your Claim.label: Stake Your Claim
Stake Your Claim.title: Control a planet in a system that contains a planet controlled by another player.

Strengthen Bonds.label: Strengthen Bonds
Strengthen Bonds.title: Have another player's promissory note in your play area.

Threaten Enemies.label: Threaten Enemies
Threaten Enemies.title: Have 1 or more ships in a system adjacent to another player's home system.

Turn Their Fleets to Dust.label: Turn Their Fleets to Dust
Turn Their Fleets to Dust.title: Use Space Cannon to destroy the last of a players ships in a system.

Unveil Flagship.label: Unveil Flagship
Unveil Flagship.title: Win a space combat in a system with your flagship without it being destroyed.

Cripple Defenses.label: Cripple Defenses
Cripple Defenses.description: Choose a planet. Destroy each PDS on that planet.

Economic Initiative.label: Economic Initiative
Economic Initiative.description: Ready each cultural planet you control.

Fighter Conscription.label: Fighter Conscription
Fighter Conscription.description: Place 1 fighter from your reinforcements in each system that contains 1 or more of your space docks or units that have capacity; they cannot be placed in systems that contain other players' ships.

Focused Research.label: Focused Research
Focused Research.description: Spend 4 trade goods to research a technology.

Frontline Deployment.label: Frontline Deployment
Frontline Deployment.description: Place 3 infantry on a planet you control.

Ghost Ship.label: Ghost Ship
Ghost Ship.description: Place a destroyer in an non-home system that contains a wormhole and does not contain other player's ships.

Impersonation.label: Impersonation
Impersonation.description: Spend 3 influence to draw 1 secret objective.

Industrial Initiative.label: Industrial Initiative
Industrial Initiative.description: Gain 1 trade good for each industrial planet you control.

Insubordination.label: Insubordination
Insubordination.description: Remove one token from another player's tactical pool.

Lucky Shot.label: Lucky Shot
Lucky Shot.description: Destroy a dreadnought, cruiser or destroyer in a system that contains a planet you control.

Mining Initiative.label: Mining Initiative
Mining Initiative.description: Gain trade goods equal to the resource value of a planet you control.

Plagiarize.label: Plagiarize
Plagiarize.description: Spend 5 influence and choose a non-faction technology owned by 1 of your neighbors; gain that technology.

Plague.label: Plague
Plague.description: Choose a planet that is controlled by another player. Roll 1 die for each infantry on that planet. For each result of 6 or greater destroy 1 of those units.

Reactor Meltdown.label: Reactor Meltdown
Reactor Meltdown.description: Destroy a spacedock in a non-home system.

Rise of a Messiah.label: Rise of a Messiah
Rise of a Messiah.description: Place one infantry on each planet you control.

Signal Jamming.label: Signal Jamming
Signal Jamming.description: Choose a non-home system that contains or is adjacent to one of your ships. Place a command token from another player's reinforcements in that system.

Spy.label: Spy
Spy.description: Another player gives you a random action card from their hand.

Tactical Bombardment.label: Tactical Bombardment
Tactical Bombardment.description: Choose a system that contains one or more of you units that have Bombardment. Exhaust each planet controlled by other players in that system.

Unexpected Action.label: Unexpected Action
Unexpected Action.description: Remove one of your command tokens from the board.

Unstable Planet.label: Unstable Planet
Unstable Planet.description: Action: Choose 1 hazardous planet. Exhaust that planet and destroy up to 3 infantry on it.

Uprising.label: Uprising
Uprising.description: Exhaust a non-home planet controlled by another player. Then, gain trade goods equal to its resource value.

War Effort.label: War Effort
War Effort.description: Place a cruiser in a system that contains your ships.

Counterstroke.label: Counterstroke
Counterstroke.description: After a player activates a system that contains 1 of your command tokens: Return that command token to your tactic pool.

Experimental Battlestation.label: Experimental Battlestation
Experimental Battlestation.description: Choose one of your space docks either in or adjacent to the activated system. That space dock uses Space Cannon 5 (x3) against ships in the active system.

Flank Speed.label: Flank Speed
Flank Speed.description: After you activate a system: Apply +1 to the move value of each of your ships during this tactical action.

Forward Supply Base.label: Forward Supply Base
Forward Supply Base.description: After another player activates a system that contains your units: Gain 3 trade goods. Then choose another player to gain 1 trade good.

Harness Energy.label: Harness Energy
Harness Energy.description: After you activate an anomaly: Replenish your commodities.

In The Silence Of Space.label: In The Silence Of Space
In The Silence Of Space.description: Choose a system. During this action your ships in that system can move through systems that contain other players' ships.

Lost Star Chart.label: Lost Star Chart
Lost Star Chart.description: During this action, systems that contain alpha and beta wormholes are adjacent to each other.

Master Plan.label: Master Plan
Master Plan.description: After you perform an action: You may perform an additional action this turn.

Rally.label: Rally
Rally.description: After you activate a system that contains another player's ships: Place 2 command tokens from your reinforcements in your fleet pool.

Reparations.label: Reparations
Reparations.description: After another player gains control of a planet you control: exhaust a planet they control and ready a planet you control.

Solar Flare.label: Solar Flare
Solar Flare.description: After you activate a system: During this movement, other players cannot use Space Cannon against your ships.

Upgrade.label: Upgrade
Upgrade.description: Replace a crusier in the activated system with a dreadnought.

War Machine.label: War Machine
War Machine.description: When 1 or more of your units use Production: Apply +4 to the total Production value of your units and reduce the combined cost of the produced units by 1.

Ancient Burial Sites.label: Ancient Burial Sites
Ancient Burial Sites.description: Exhaust all of one player's cultural planets.

Assassinate Representative.label: Assassinate Representative
Assassinate Representative.description: Choose a player. That player cannot vote on this agenda.

Bribery.label: Bribery
Bribery.description: After the speaker votes on an agenda: Spend any number of trade goods. For each trade good spent, cast 1 additional vote for the outcome on which you voted.

Confusing Legal Text.label: Confusing Legal Text
Confusing Legal Text.description: When you are elected as the outcome of an agenda: Choose a player to be the elected player instead.

Construction Rider.label: Construction Rider
Construction Rider.description: After an agenda is revealed: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, place 1 space dock on a planet you control.

Diplomacy Rider.label: Diplomacy Rider
Diplomacy Rider.description: After an agenda is revealed: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, choose 1 system that contains a planet you control. Each other player places a command token from their reinforcements in that system.

Distinguished Councilor.label: Distinguished Councilor
Distinguished Councilor.description: After you cast votes on an outcome of an agenda cast 5 additional votes.

Hack Election.label: Hack Election
Hack Election.description: After an agenda is revealed: During this agenda, voting begins with the player to the right of the speaker and continues counterclockwise.

Imperial Rider.label: Imperial Rider
Imperial Rider.description: After an agenda is revealed: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 1 victory point.

Insider Information.label: Insider Information
Insider Information.description: After an agenda is revealed: Look at the top card of the agenda deck.

Leadership Rider.label: Leadership Rider
Leadership Rider.description: After an agenda is revealed: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 3 command tokens.

Politics Rider.label: Politics Rider
Politics Rider.description: After an agenda is revealed: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, draw 3 action cards and gain the speaker token.

Sanction.label: Sanction
Sanction.description: After an agenda is revealed: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict alound an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, each player that voted for that outcome returns 1 command token from their fleet supply to their reinforcements.

Technology Rider.label: Technology Rider
Technology Rider.description: After an agenda is revealed: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, research a technology.

Trade Rider.label: Trade Rider
Trade Rider.description: After an agenda is revealed: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, gain 5 trade goods.

Veto.label: Veto
Veto.description: When an agenda is revealed: Discard that agenda and reveal 1 agenda from the top of the deck. Players vote on this agenda instead.

Warfare Rider.label: Warfare Rider
Warfare Rider.description: After an agenda is revealed: You cannot vote on this agenda. Predict aloud an outcome of this agenda. If your prediction is correct, place 1 dreadnought in a system that contains your ships.

Blitz.label: Blitz
Blitz.description: At the start of an invasion: Each of your non-fighter ships in the active system that do not have Bombardment gain Bombardment 6 until the end of the invasion.

Bunker.label: Bunker
Bunker.description: During this invasion apply -4 to the result of each Bombardment roll against planets you control.

Courageous to the End.label: Courageous to the End
Courageous to the End.description: After one of your ships is destroyed in space combat roll 2 dice. For each result equal to or great then that ships combat value, your opponent must choose and destroy one of their ships.

Direct Hit.label: Direct Hit
Direct Hit.description: After another player’s ship uses 'Sustain Damage' to cancel a hit produced by your units or abilities: Destroy that ship.

Disable.label: Disable
Disable.description: Your opponent's PDS units lose Planetary Shield and Space Cannon during this invasion.

Emergency Repairs.label: Emergency Repairs
Emergency Repairs.description: At the start or end of a combat round repair all of your units that have Sustain Damage in the active system.

Fighter Prototype.label: Fighter Prototype
Fighter Prototype.description: Your fighters have +2 to combat rolls during the first round of combat.

Fire Team.label: Fire Team
Fire Team.description: Reroll any number of your ground combat dice.

Ghost Squad.label: Ghost Squad
Ghost Squad.description: After a player commits units to land on a planet you control: Move any number of ground forces from any planet you control in the active system to any other planet you control in the active system.

Infiltrate.label: Infiltrate
Infiltrate.description: When you gain control of a planet replace each PDS and space dock on that planet instead of destroying them.

Intercept.label: Intercept
Intercept.description: After your opponent declares a retreat during space combat that retreat is cancelled (they may retreat in future rounds).

Maneuvering Jets.label: Maneuvering Jets
Maneuvering Jets.description: Before you assign hits produced by another player's Space Cannon roll: Cancel 1 hit.

Morale Boost.label: Morale Boost
Morale Boost.description: At the start of a combat round: Apply +1 to the result of each of your unit's combat rolls during this combat round.

Parley.label: Parley
Parley.description: After another player commits units to land on a planet you control, return the committed units to the space area.

Reflective Shielding.label: Reflective Shielding
Reflective Shielding.description: When one of your ships uses Sustain Damage during combat: Produce 2 hits against your opponent's ships in the active system.

Salvage.label: Salvage
Salvage.description: After you win a space combat your opponent gives you all of his commodities.

Scramble Frequency.label: Scramble Frequency
Scramble Frequency.description: After another player makes a Bombardment, Space Cannon or Anti-Fighter Barrage roll: That player rerolls all of their dice.

Shields Holding.label: Shields Holding
Shields Holding.description: Before you assign hits to your ships during a space combat: Cancel up to 2 hits.

Skilled Retreat.label: Skilled Retreat
Skilled Retreat.description: At the start of a combat round: Move all of your ships from the active system into an adjacent system that does not contain another player's ships; the space combat ends in a draw. Then, place a command token from your reinforcements in that system.

Sabotage.label: Sabotage
Sabotage.description: When another player plays an action card other then 'Sabotage': Cancel that action card.

Political Stability.label: Political Stability
Political Stability.description: You do not return your strategy card(s) during this phase and do not choose new strategy cards in the next strategy phase.

Public Disgrace.label: Public Disgrace
Public Disgrace.description: When another player chooses a strategy card: That player must choose a different strategy cards instead, if able.

Enigmatic Device.label: Enigmatic Device
Enigmatic Device.description: Action: You may spend 6 resources and purge this card to research 1 technology.

Anti-Intellectual Revolution.label: Anti-Intellectual Revolution
Anti-Intellectual Revolution.for: After a player researches a technology, they must destroy one of their non-fighter ships.
Anti-Intellectual Revolution.against: At the start of the next strategy phase each player exhausts one planet for each technology they have researched.

Arms Reduction.label: Arms Reduction
Arms Reduction.for: Each player destroys all but 2 of their dreadnaughts and all but 4 of their cruisers.
Arms Reduction.against: At the start of the next strategy phase, each player exhausts each of their planets with a technology specialty.

Classified Document Leaks.label: Classified Document Leaks
Classified Document Leaks.for: The elected secret objective becomes a public objective.

Colonial Redistribution.label: Colonial Redistribution
Colonial Redistribution.for: Destroy each unit on the planet. It's controller chooses a player with the fewest victory points to place 1 infantry on the planet.

Committee Formation.label: Committee Formation
Committee Formation.for: This card may be discarded during a future agenda to choose a player to be elected for an agenda, bypassing the voting process.

Compensated Disarmament.label: Compensated Disarmament
Compensated Disarmament.for: Destroy each ground force on the planet. For each unit destroyed, the player who controls that planet gains 1 trade good.

Conventions of War.label: Conventions of War
Conventions of War.for: Players cannot use Bombardment against cultural planets. Players who voted 'Against' discard all of their action cards.

Core Mining.label: Core Mining
Core Mining.for: Destoy 1 infantry on that planet. It resource value is increased by 2.

Demilitarized Zone.label: Demilitarized Zone
Demilitarized Zone.for: Destroy all units on that planet. Player's units cannot land, be produced on or be placed on this planet.

Economic Equality.label: Economic Equality
Economic Equality.for: All players discard all trade goods, then draw 5.
Economic Equality.against: All players discard all trade goods.

Enforced Travel Ban.label: Enforced Travel Ban
Enforced Travel Ban.for: Players cannot use alpha or beta wormholes.
Enforced Travel Ban.against: Destroy each PDS in/adjacent to a wormhole.

Executive Sanctions.label: Executive Sanctions
Executive Sanctions.for: All players have a maximum of 3 action cards in hand.
Executive Sanctions.against: Each player dicards a random action card.

Fleet Regulations.label: Fleet Regulations
Fleet Regulations.for: Each player cannot have more than 4 tokens in their fleet pool.
Fleet Regulations.against: Each player gains 1 command token into their fleet pool.

Holy Planet of Ixth.label: Holy Planet of Ixth
Holy Planet of Ixth.for: The planet's controller gains 1VP. Units on this planet cannot use Production.

Homeland Defense Act.label: Homeland Defense Act
Homeland Defense Act.for: Each player can have any number of PDS on planets they control.

Imperial Arbiter.label: Imperial Arbiter
Imperial Arbiter.for: At the end of the strategy phase this card may be discarded to swap one of this player's strategy cards with 1 of another player's strategy cards.

Incentive Program.label: Incentive Program
Incentive Program.for: Draw and reveal an additional stage 1 public objective.
Incentive Program.against: Draw and reveal an additional stage 2 public objective.

Ixthian Artifact.label: Ixthian Artifact
Ixthian Artifact.for: The speaker rolls a die. 1-5: Destroy all units on Mecatol Rex & 3 units in each system adjacent to Mecatol Rex. 6-10: Each player researches 2 technologies.

Minister of Commerce.label: Minister of Commerce
Minister of Commerce.for: After the owner of this card replenishes commodities, they gain a trade good for each player that is their neighbor.

Minister of Exploration.label: Minister of Exploration
Minister of Exploration.for: When the owner of this cards gains control of a planet, they gain a trade good.

Minister of Industry.label: Minister of Industry
Minister of Industry.for: When the owner of this card places a space dock in a system, their units in that system use Production abilities.

Minister of Peace.label: Minister of Peace
Minister of Peace.for: After a player activates a system that contains 1 or more of a different player's units, the owner of this card may discard it to immediately end the active player's turn.

Minister of Policy.label: Minister of Policy
Minister of Policy.for: The owner draws an extra action card during the status phase.

Minister of Sciences.label: Minister of Sciences
Minister of Sciences.for: When the owner of this card resolves the primary or secondary ability of the Technology Strategy card, they do not need to spend resources.

Minister of War.label: Minister of War
Minister of War.for: The owner of this card may discard this card after performing an action to remove one of their command tokens on the board. Then, they may perform an additional action.

Miscount Disclosed.label: Miscount Disclosed
Miscount Disclosed.for: Vote on that law again, as if it was revealed.

Mutiny.label: Mutiny
Mutiny.for: Each player who voted 'For' gains 1 VP.
Mutiny.against: Each player who voted 'For' loses 1 VP.

New Constitution.label: New Constitution
New Constitution.for: Discard all laws in play. Exhaust all home systems next strategy phase.

Prophecy of Ixth.label: Prophecy of Ixth
Prophecy of Ixth.for: The owner of this card applies +1 to their fighter's combat rolls. When the owner of this card uses a Production ability they discard this card unless they produce at least 2 fighters.

Public Execution.label: Public Execution
Public Execution.for: Elected player discards all action cards. If they have the speaker token, they pass it to the player on their left. They cannot vote on further agendas during this agenda phase.

Publicize Weapon Schematics.label: Publicize Weapon Schematics
Publicize Weapon Schematics.for: If a player has Warsun technology all players may ignore that technology's prerequisites. All warsuns lose sustain damage.
Publicize Weapon Schematics.against: Each player with war sun technology discards all of their action cards.

Regulated Conscription.label: Regulated Conscription
Regulated Conscription.for: Each fighter or infantry requires 1 resource instead of 1/2 of a resource to produce.

Representatative Government.label: Representatative Government
Representatative Government.for: Players cannot exhaust planets to cast votes during the agenda phase. Each player may cast 1 vote on each agenda.
Representatative Government.against: At the start of the next strategy phase, each player that voted 'Against' exhausts all of his cultural planets.

Research Team: Biotic.label: Research Team: Biotic
Research Team: Biotic.for: When this planet's owner researches technology they may exhaust this planet to ignore a green prerequisite.

Research Team: Cybernetic.label: Research Team: Cybernetic
Research Team: Cybernetic.for: When this planet's owner researches technology they may exhaust this planet to ignore a yellow prerequisite.

Research Team: Propulsion.label: Research Team: Propulsion
Research Team: Propulsion.for: When this planet's owner researches technology they may exhaust this planet to ignore a blue prerequisite.

Research Team: Warfare.label: Research Team: Warfare
Research Team: Warfare.for: When this planet's owner researches technology they may exhaust this planet to ignore a red prerequisite.

Seed of an Empire.label: Seed of an Empire
Seed of an Empire.for: The player with most VP gains 1 VP.
Seed of an Empire.against: The player with the fewest VP gains 1 VP.

Senate Sanctuary.label: Senate Sanctuary
Senate Sanctuary.for: The influence value of this planet is increased by 2.

Shard of the Throne.label: Shard of the Throne
Shard of the Throne.for: This card is worth 1VP. If a player wins a combat against the player that has this card, they gain this card.

Shared Research.label: Shared Research
Shared Research.against: Each player places a command token in their home system.

Swords to Plowshares.label: Swords to Plowshares
Swords to Plowshares.for: Each player destroys half of their infantry (rounded up) on each planet. Each player gains a trade good for each unit they destroyed.
Swords to Plowshares.against: Each player gains 1 infantry on each planet they control.

Terraforming Initiative.label: Terraforming Initiative
Terraforming Initiative.for: The influence and resource values of this planet are each increased by 1.

The Crown of Emphidia.label: The Crown of Emphidia
The Crown of Emphidia.for: This card is worth 1VP. If a player gains control of a planet in this player's home system they gain this card.

The Crown of Thalnos.label: The Crown of Thalnos
The Crown of Thalnos.for: During each round this card's owner may reroll any number of his dice. Any units that reroll but do not produce a hit are destroyed.

Unconventional Measures.label: Unconventional Measures
Unconventional Measures.for: Each player that voted 'For' draws 2 action cards.
Unconventional Measures.against: Each player that voted 'For' discards all of their action cards.

Wormhole Reconstruction.label: Wormhole Reconstruction
Wormhole Reconstruction.for: Systems that contain an alpha or beta wormhole are adjacent to each other.
Wormhole Reconstruction.against: Each player places a command token in each system with one of their ships and either an alpha or beta wormhole.

Wormhole Research.label: Wormhole Research
Wormhole Research.for: Each player with a ship in a system with an alpha or beta wormhole destroys all his ships in those systems, then researches a technology.
Wormhole Research.against: Each player who voted 'Against' removes a command token from his command sheet.

Cultural Relic Fragment.label: Cultural Relic Fragment
Cultural Relic Fragment.effect: Purge 3 of your cultural relic fragments to gain 1 relic.

Demilitarized Zone.label: Demilitarized Zone
Demilitarized Zone.effect: Return all structures on this planet to your reinforcements. Then, return all ground forces on this planet to the space area. ATTACH: Units cannot be committed to, produced on, or placed on this planet. During the agenda phase, this planet's planet card can be traded as part of a transaction.

Dyson Sphere.label: Dyson Sphere
Dyson Sphere.effect: This planet's resource value is increased by 2 and its influence value is increased by 1.

Freelancers.label: Freelancers
Freelancers.effect: You may produce 1 unit in this system; you may spend influence as if it were resources to produce this unit.

Gamma Wormhole.label: Gamma Wormhole
Gamma Wormhole.effect: Place a gamma wormhole token in this system. Then, purge this card.

Mercenary Outfit.label: Mercenary Outfit
Mercenary Outfit.effect: You may place 1 infantry from your reinforcements on this planet.

Paradise World.label: Paradise World
Paradise World.effect: This planet's influence value is increased by 2.

Tomb of Emphidia.label: Tomb of Emphidia
Tomb of Emphidia.effect: This planet's influence value is increased by 1.

Core Mine.label: Core Mine
Core Mine.effect: If you have at least 1 mech on this planet, or if you remove 1 infantry from this planet, gain 1 trade good.

Expedition.label: Expedition
Expedition.effect: If you have at least 1 mech on this planet, or if you remove 1 infantry from this planet, ready this planet.

Hazardous Relic Fragment.label: Hazardous Relic Fragment
Hazardous Relic Fragment.effect: Purge 3 of your hazardous relic fragments to gain 1 relic.

Lazax Survivors.label: Lazax Survivors
Lazax Survivors.effect: This planet's resource value is increased by 1 and its influence value is increased by 2.

Mining World.label: Mining World
Mining World.effect: This planet's resource value is increased by 2.

Rich World.label: Rich World
Rich World.effect: This planet's resource value is increased by 1.

Volatile Fuel Source.label: Volatile Fuel Source
Volatile Fuel Source.effect: If you have at least 1 mech on this planet, or if you remove 1 infantry from this planet, gain 1 command token.

Warfare Research Facility.label: Warfare Research Facility
Warfare Research Facility.effect: This planet has a red technology specialty; if this planet already has a technology specialty, this planet's resource and influence values are each increased by 1 instead.

Abandoned Warehouses.label: Abandoned Warehouses
Abandoned Warehouses.effect: You may gain 2 commodities, or you may convert up to 2 of your commodities to trade goods.

Biotic Research Facility.label: Biotic Research Facility
Biotic Research Facility.effect: This planet has a green technology specialty; if this planet already has a technology specialty, this planet's resource and influence values are each increased by 1 instead.

Cybernetic Research Facility.label: Cybernetic Research Facility
Cybernetic Research Facility.effect: This planet has a yellow technology specialty; if this planet already has a technology specialty, this planet's resource and influence values are each increased by 1 instead.

Functioning Base.label: Functioning Base
Functioning Base.effect: You may gain 1 commodity, or you may spend 1 trade good or 1 commodity to draw 1 action card.

Industrial Relic Fragment.label: Industrial Relic Fragment
Industrial Relic Fragment.effect: Purge 3 of your industrial relic fragments to gain 1 relic.

Local Fabricators.label: Local Fabricators
Local Fabricators.effect: You may gain 1 commodity, or you may spend 1 trade good or 1 commodity to place 1 mech from your reinforcements on this planet.

Propulsion Research Facility.label: Propulsion Research Facility
Propulsion Research Facility.effect: This planet has a blue technology specialty; if this planet already has a technology specialty, this planet's resource and influence values are each increased by 1 instead.

Enigmatic Device.label: Enigmatic Device
Enigmatic Device.effect: Place this card faceup in your play area. ACTION: You may spend 6 resources and purge this card to research 1 technology.

Gamma Relay.label: Gamma Relay
Gamma Relay.effect: Place a gamma wormhole token in this system. Then, purge this card.

Ion Storm.label: Ion Storm
Ion Storm.effect: Place the ion storm token in this system with either side faceup. Then, place this card in the common play area. At the end of the 'Move Ships' or 'Retreat' substep of a tactical action during which 1 or more of your ships use the ion storm wormhole, flip the ion storm token to its opposing side.

Merchant Station.label: Merchant Station
Merchant Station.effect: You may replenish your commodities, or you may convert your commodities to trade goods.

Mirage.label: Mirage
Mirage.effect: Place the Mirage planet token in this system. Gain the Mirage planet card and ready it. Then, purge this card.

Unknown Relic Fragment.label: Unknown Relic Fragment
Unknown Relic Fragment.effect: This card counts as a relic fragment of any type.

Dominus Orb.label: Dominus Orb
Dominus Orb.effect: Before you move units during a tactical action, you may purge this card to move and transport units that are in systems that contain 1 your command tokens.

Maw of Worlds.label: Maw of Worlds
Maw of Worlds.effect: At the start of the agenda phase, you may purge this card and exhaust all of your planets to gain any 1 technology.

Scepter of Emelpar.label: Scepter of Emelpar
Scepter of Emelpar.effect: When you would spend a token from your strategy pool, you may exhaust this card to spend a token from your reinforcements instead.

Shard of the Throne.label: Shard of the Throne
Shard of the Throne.effect: When you gain this card, gain 1 victory point; when you lose this card, lose 1 victory point. When a player gains control of a legendary planet you control or a planet you control in your home system, that player gains this card.

Stellar Converter.label: Stellar Converter
Stellar Converter.effect: Choose 1 non-home, non-legendary planet other than Mecatol Rex in a system that is adjacent to 1 or more of your units that have Bombardment; destroy all units on that planet and purge its attachments and its planet card. Then, place the destroyed planet token on that planet and purge this card.

The Codex.label: The Codex
The Codex.effect: Purge this card to take up to 3 action cards of your choice from the action card discard pile.

The Crown of Emphidia.label: The Crown of Emphidia
The Crown of Emphidia.effect: After you perform a tactical action, you may exhaust this card to explore 1 planet you control. At the end of the status phase, if you control the 'Tomb of Emphidia', you may purge this card to gain 1 victory point.

The Crown of Thalnos.label: The Crown of Thalnos
The Crown of Thalnos.effect: During each combat round, this card's owner may reroll any number of their dice, applying +1 to the results; any units that reroll dice but do not produce at least 1 hit are destroyed.

The Obsidian.label: The Obsidian
The Obsidian.effect: When you gain this card, draw 1 secret objective. You can have 1 additional scored or unscored secret objective.

The Prophet's Tears.label: The Prophet's Tears
The Prophet's Tears.effect: When you research a technology, you may exhaust this card to ignore 1 prerequisite or draw 1 action card.

Nano-Forge.label: Nano-Forge
Nano-Forge.effect: Attach this card to a non-legendary, non-home planet you control; its resource and influence values are increased by 2 and it is a legendary planet.

Dynamis Core.label: Dynamis Core
Dynamis Core.effect: Attach this card to a non-legendary, non-home planet you control; its resource and influence values are increased by 2 and it is a legendary planet.

Lost Titan Prototype.label: JR-XS455-O (Lost Titan Prototype)
Lost Titan Prototype.effect: Exhaust this agent and choose a player; that playe rmay spend 3 resources to place a structure on a planet they control. If they do not, they gain 1 trade good.
